Grouped_Utterances: Hey! I’ve been doing pretty well. I researched a few animal care courses, and I even signed up for one!

It felt empowering. I’m excited but also a bit nervous about starting. I’m looking forward to learning more about animal behavior and how to care for them properly. I think it’ll help me feel more confident. I had a moment of doubt where I questioned if I was making the right decision, but I pushed through it. I reminded myself of how much I love being around animals and why I wanted to pursue this in the first place. I still struggle with self-doubt occasionally, especially when I think about my future.

It made me feel really happy and connected. I realized how much I want to help animals in need. Yes, I feel less overwhelmed. I’m learning to say no to things that don’t serve me. I think it’s improved them. I’m more present when I engage with others because I’m not overcommitting. I feel more balanced. I still have my moments, but I’m learning to cope better. It feels empowering! I’m excited to see how it affects my mindset.

I’ve been spending more time at the animal shelter, and I even helped organize a small adoption event. It went really well! We had a good turnout, and a few animals found homes. I think I can manage it. I’ve been more organized with my time lately, which helps. I’ve started using a planner to schedule my days, which helps me prioritize my commitments.
I’ve been trying to practice positive affirmations and remind myself of my accomplishments. Yes, I’d like to use “I am capable of creating the life I want.”
I’m considering volunteering more regularly and possibly exploring career options in animal care.
